description: Dated in the late 16th century C.E.; from Latin dialysis, from Ancient Greek διάλυσις (diálusis); synchronically, dia- +‎ -lysis.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) A method of separating molecules or particles of different sizes by differential diffusion through a semipermeable membrane.
(medicine) Utilization of this method for removal of waste products from the blood in the case of kidney failure: hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis.
(rhetoric) The spelling out of alternatives, or presenting of either-or arguments that lead to a conclusion.
